com.geom.model

Class Factory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.geom.model.Factory

  • public class Factory
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that implements the creation of a geometric shape Handles aligned points and points that have the same coordinates
    Author:
    Dasha

    • Method Detail

      • gfigure

        public static Figure gfigure(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D> parameters)
        Generates the geometric shapes given an ArrayList of points. The core idea is to first count the number of points then rely on specific properties about the sides to identify more specifically which Shape to build. Therefore, the Factory class is inherited by FactoryTriangular, FactoryQuadrilateral and FactoryPolygonal that are dedicated to a given family of shapes.
        Parameters:
        parameters - is an ArrayList of Points
        Returns:
        Figure i.e a new shape(triangle, square, Rhombus, etc)

      • hasRightAngle

        public static boolean hasRightAngle(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D> parameters)
        Verifies if there are right angles in the shape. Relies on the fact that cos(Pi/2 + k*Pi) = 0, with k a given integer.
        Parameters:
        parameters - is an ArrayList of points.
        Returns:
        true if the shape contains right angles

      • hasEqualSides

        public static boolean hasEqualSides(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D> parameters)
        Verifies if the lengths of the sides are all equal.
        Parameters:
        parameters - is an arrayList of Points
        Returns:
        true if the shape is equilateral

      • sin

        public static double sin(java.awt.geom.Point2D pt1,
                         java.awt.geom.Point2D pt2,
                         java.awt.geom.Point2D pt3)
        Computes the sine of the angle between three points. Use the properties of the cross product of two vectors in a 2D euclidean space. Here, we consider that counter-clockwise oriented angles are positive.
        Parameters:
        pt1 - Point defined by a location in a coordinate space
        pt2 - Point defined by a location in a coordinate space
        pt3 - Point defined by a location in a coordinate space
        Returns:
        the value of sin between the vector p2p3 and p2p1

      • cos

        public static double cos(java.awt.geom.Point2D pt1,
                         java.awt.geom.Point2D pt2,
                         java.awt.geom.Point2D pt3)
        Calculates the cosine of the angle between three points Use the properties of the scalar product of two vectors in a 2D euclidean space.
        Parameters:
        pt1 - Point defined by a location in a coordinate space
        pt2 - Point defined by a location in a coordinate space
        pt3 - Point defined by a location in a coordinate space
        Returns:
        the value of cosine between the vector p2p1 and p2p3

      • coss

        public static double[] coss(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D> points)
        Calculates the cosine of the angles of a given polygon. The orientation of the shape will depend on the order of the points a priori.
        Parameters:
        points - ArrayList of the points of a shape
        Returns:
        an Array of the cosine of each angle

      • sins

        public static double[] sins(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D> points)
        Calculates the sines of the angles of a given polygon. The orientation of the shape will depend on the order of the points a priori.
        Parameters:
        points - ArrayList of the points of a shape.
        Returns:
        an Array of the sine of each angle.

      • rejectALinedPoint

        public static void rejectALinedPoint(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D> points)
        Should delete a point aligned to two other points. For three points p1, p2, p3, this method will compute the sine of (p2p3, p2p1) If the sine is null, it will remove p2.
        Parameters:
        points - ArrayList of Points of a given geometric shape

      • isEquiangular

        public static boolean isEquiangular(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.geom.Point2D> points)
        Verifies if the picture is equiangular. Relies on the fact that two angles are equaled in measure once their sine and cosine are equal.
        Parameters:
        points - is an ArrayList of points.
        Returns:
        true if all the angles are equal.
